title.content-text: 3.1.1 - O S I and TCP/IP Model

brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts the O S I model and TCP/IP model divided into two sections: Application Layer and Data Flow Layer. The top three layers of the O S I model, Application, Presentation, and Session, map roughly to the Application Layer of the TCP/IP model. The Data Flow layers are the bottom four layers: Transport, Network, Data Link, and Physical for the O S I model, and the Transport, Internet, and Network Access layers of the TCP/IP model.
Examples of protocols that operate at the Application Layer are:
- Domain Name System (DNS)
- Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)
An example of a protocol that operates at the Transport Layer is:
- Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP)
An example of a protocol that operates at the Internet or Network Layer is:
- Post Office Protocol (POP)
An example of a protocol that operates at the Network Access or Data Link Layer is:
- Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)
